page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: INTRODUCTION Wigmore is a small village situated about 10 miles N.W of Leominster on the A4110 four miles south of Leintwardine.It was once a very important town.There is a castle just outside the village which was first built by order of King Edward in 921A.D. It was later replaced by a Norman castle which housed the Mortimer family.It was very important in Norman times.The village has several buisnesses and still boosts a Norman church in the shadow of the castle from which breathtaking views over the Wigmore basin can be observed
